intro: Centella laevis, commonly known as the smooth centella, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, smooth leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The smooth texture of its leaves is a distinguishing feature, setting it apart from other species in the genus.
